channel.title: Google Summer of Code on ZAP
channel.description: Recent content in Google Summer of Code on ZAP

item.title: GSoC 2020
item.description: The following projects were chosen for GSoC 2020: GraphQL Support Contributor: Akshath Kothari Add-on: GraphQL Support Code: graphql Blog: Introducing the GraphQL Add-on for ZAP Mentors: Simon Bennetts Ricardo Pereira Rick Mitchell

item.title: GSoC 2021
item.description: The following projects were chosen for GSoC 2021: Out-of-band Application Security Testing Contributor: Akshath Kothari Add-on: OAST Support Code: oast Blog: Out-of-band Application Security Testing with OWASP ZAP Mentors: Simon Bennetts Ricardo Pereira Rick Mitchell Retesting Alerts Contributor: Pranav Saxena Add-on: Retest Code: retest Blog: Retesting alerts with OWASP ZAP Mentors: Simon Bennetts Ricardo Pereira Rick Mitchell

item.title: GSoC 2022
item.description: The following projects were chosen for GSoC 2022: Param Digger Contributor: Arkaprabha Chakraborty Add-on: Parameter Digger Code: parameterdigger Blog: The Param Digger Add-on GSOC 2022 Mentors: Simon Bennetts Ricardo Pereira Rick Mitchell

item.title: GSoC 2023
item.description: The following projects were chosen for GSoC 2023: Browser Recorder Contributor: Aryan Gupta Add-on: Client Side Integration Code: browser-extension client Blog: GSoC 2023 Browser Recorder Mentors: Simon Bennetts Ricardo Pereira Rick Mitchell Postman Support Contributor: Vitika Soni Add-on: Postman Support Code: postman Blog: Postman Add-on Mentors: Simon Bennetts Ricardo Pereira Rick Mitchell

item.title: GSoC 2024
item.description: We are hoping to take part in GSoC 2024 as a new GSoC organisation. Do check out the GSoC Advice and Guidance Potential Projects gRPC Support Issue: #7695 gRPC Support gRPC requests should already be shown in the History / Sites tree as binary requests. This project would add support for:

item.title: GSoC Advice and Guidance
item.description: If you would like to contribute to ZAP as part of Google Summer of Code then you should start contributing to ZAP ASAP. We will only consider candidates who have made a code PR to ZAP that has been merged. Candidates who have made more contributions to ZAP will be at an advantage, so start with good-first-issues and then move onto good-second-issues.
